thread.title: The 10-Point.

author: Gerard Baker
title: The 10-Point.
text:
Good morning,
China Syndrome
While much of the worldâ€™s attention remains focused on the possibility of military action in Syria by the U.S. and its allies, the economic picture remains clouded by uncertainties about trade. The Journal reports today that the White House plans to increase pressure on China by threatening to block technology investment in the U.S. and focusing on new tariffs. As early as next week, it will name the products on the list of $100 billion in Chinese goods subject to 25% import tariffs. The initial... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
